Indications and doses

Constipation,

By rectum

  • For adults
    5–10 mg once dailyIncreased if necessary up to 20 mg once daily, dose to be taken at night.
  • For adults
    10 mg once daily, dose to be taken in the morning.
  • For children 4–17 years
    5–20 mg once daily, adjusted according to response, dose to be taken at night.
  • For children 2–17 years
    5–10 mg once daily, adjusted according to response.

Bowel clearance before radiological procedures and surgery,

Initially by mouth

  • For adults
    10 mg twice daily, does to be taken in the morning and evening on the day before procedure and (by rectum) 10 mg, to be administered 1–2 hours before procedure the following day.

Pharmacokinetics

Tablets act in 10–12 hours; suppositories act in 20–60 minutes.

Advice when patient is pregnant

May be suitable for constipation in pregnancy, if a stimulant effect is necessary.

Contra indications

  • children: Acute abdominal conditions in children
  • acute inflammatory bowel disease
  • adults: acute surgical abdominal conditions in adults
  • intestinal obstruction
  • severe dehydration

Known side effects

General side effects

notKnown: Abdominal cramp, colitis, nausea, vomiting,

Specific side effects

notKnown: local irritation,

Cautions regarding administration

  • Excessive use of stimulant laxatives can cause diarrhoea and related effects such as hypokalaemia
  • : risk of electrolyte imbalance with prolonged use in children

Prepared medicinal forms of BISACODYL

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: oral suspension, enema, suppository,
